name: Hilton Garden Inn Portland Downtown Waterfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When reading previous reviews we were a bit nervous but from the valet to the front desk, to the restaurant & maid service, this hotel was top notch. The location couldn't be better. The only downside is that when planning your trip keep in mind that if you come by car you need to figure an extra $15 a day for parking. The price was comparable, or better than parking lots in the area, but when booking it is not mentioned (or at least I didn't see it)
reviews.title: Great Location, friendly staff

reviews.text: This hotel is first class! Located right on waterfront and the rooms are luxurious. Staff was very friendly. Beds were very comfortable. Rooms were extremely clean.
reviews.title: Beautiful room in very nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay in a Hilton Garden Inn and it was pretty good. We got a basic room and our rate went down about $10 from what we prepaid. We called and the girl who answered at the front desk phone before we arrived gave us a corner suite facing the harbor and free breakfast! Pretty good deal! Our room was beautiful and the view was very active of the busy intersection, but didn't feel very private being on the second floor. I guess that's why they invented curtains. The employees were not that helpful or friendly at all once we got there. The front desk staff was either overwhelmed or kinda rude. Our room was nice and clean and close to many good restaurants so we were very happy with our stay. This place is very pricey compared to most of Portland so make sure location is a priority because if its not then you do not need to pay the extra money. If you want to be in the most convenient location in Portland then this is the place, just don't expect the employees to care much about you.
reviews.title: Great except for...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love seaport towns and are lucky because Boston, Newport, Portsmouth NH and Portland Maine are all within easy drivng range for us. We just got back from a two day stay in Portland Maine at the Hilton Garden Inn Downtown Waterfront so while things are still fresh in my mind this would be a good time to give a review of the hotel and the local area. The hotel is on Commercial Street which is basically on the water. Across the street are muliple piers loaded with resturants, pubs and commercial fishing companies. It's a working port so there is a real world feel to the area in addition to all the tourist stuff.
reviews.title: Very Good experience

reviews.text: Check in was easy. The parking valet service and front desk were welcoming. Our room was on the 2nd floor. We had a water view but the ferry service parking garage is right in front of the hotel so we only had a side view of the ocean. Next time I will request a higher floor for a better view. Our room was clean and well maintained. The breakfast buffet was very good and reasonably priced. There is a hotel bar that opens a five PM and is a good place to have a quite drink and a friendly conversation after a day of touring the city.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay in Portland, ME- Great Location Downtown.

reviews.text: My colleague and I found the staff at the Hilton Garden Inn to be top notch. The valet, desk clerks and bar/restaurant staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Great location in the Old Port, close to all restaurants and shopping. We were fortunate to be on government business, so enjoyed a low rate. We would return with no hesitation.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful customer service

reviews.text: Exceptionally helpful and courteous staff. Clean, quiet hotel was a quick walk to any of a number of outstanding eateries. No extra fees for business service desk or gym is always a plus in my book.
reviews.title: Modern and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would gladly stay here again for either business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Bad Service
Great location in a very comfortable hotel right on the Portland waterfront.
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel 20 minutes after the 4 o'clock check-in. Our room was not ready. When we asked the woman at the counter what time it would be ready, she said she did not know, probably hald an hour. We put our bags back in the car and let them valet it while we went across the street to get something to eat. When we came back an HOUR later, the room STILL was not ready. The gave us coupons for a free drink at the bar and did not charge us for the parking. We waited at the bar for another half an hour until someone came to tell us our room was finally ready. It took almost two hours to get our room! When we asked the valet to bring our car around so we could get our bags, he appeared to be busy. He handed us the keys and pointed to where our car was. We had to get through the maze of tightly parked cars to get to our vehicle. When I tried to open the truck to get my bags, I had to step in 2 feet of snow to get to the back of the car. The staff were all very kind, but we are not impressed with the service and will not be staying here again.

We've stayed a couple times at the Hilton Garden Inn and have had consistently good service and pleasant stays. The valets are courteous and helpful, keeping our car close at hand when we wanted to dash off again, and warmed and waiting after we called down from our room upon our departure. Service all around has been accommodating and the location is great for walking to downtown sights and restaurants. Our room was spacious, quiet and clean with great views over the waterfront. We'll be coming back again for a Portland getaway.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again when in Portland. The location is perfect. The valet and front desk are super friendly. The room was very clean with a small fridge and microwave.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly & Clean
By far, the best hotel in Southern Maine
reviews.text: Great staff, great rooms, great location and the best car valets ever!

My husband had to travel for business, and I went along to do some shopping. The valet parking was well worth the 15 dollar daily charge. I left and returned numerous times with my vehicle and the valet was so helpful and courteous. I loved that they had a pantry by the front desk, open 24 hours, stocked with snacks (even single serve ice cream), bottled water, microwave meals, etc. Our stay at Hilton Garden was like home away from home. The bedding/bed was very similar to our bed at home, which made for no loss of sleep.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super location if exploring the Old Port is your mission. Very comfortable lodging.Not the least expensive , But the location and above average scores in all areas make this a real good value. Its surely worth the few extra bucks. Clean, great service, nice bed and bedding, breakfast buffet was very good. I will be returning for sure.
reviews.title: Super location, location, location

reviews.text: I've stayed here before and probably even reviewed it long ago. The location is fantastic, but that's it's only selling point for me, and even then only if the price is right. If the rate is high, it's defintiely not worth staying there.
reviews.title: The location is good but overall it's nothing but average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, comfortable, great location within walking distance to pier, restaurants, shopping.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: There are better value hotels in Portland Maine, and probably just as convenient. Breakfast was not included and outrageously over priced (get real Hlton!) But for lacation you get to be a street crossing away from the water front. And don't go up the hll to eat in the pricey restaurants sugggested by the hotel reception, go just across the road to eg the Irish Pub (see photo) or any of the other dozens of outlets for good quality food incl lobsters. The Oyster Bar was OK but a bit of a disappointment, but Becky's diner across the road and turn right walk about 400 mters, was a bit of fun for breakfast.
reviews.title: Its OK, barely. And pricey
Best Customer Service
reviews.text: I contacted over 10 hotels/inns/B&Bs in Portland - from big chain hotels, to small upscale hotels, to Inns and B&Bs - to find out room rates for our first visit to Portland (for a vacation) with my husband and 10-year old. The customer service agent (Jen) was friendly, cheerful, eager to help, and informative without being pushy. She actually listened to my situation and made very helpful suggestions. And she got me information fast without treating me like she wanted to move on to the next client. I haven't actually stayed at the hotel yet (thus the 4 stars, not 5), but I thought it was worth writing up a review before my stay just for the great customer service experience! As far as I'm concerned, the Hilton gets top ratings for customer service and for making me feel well informed and good about visiting Portland.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What makes a good hotel? Hotel rooms are fairly similar. The restaurants and bars are similar. What makes a hotel good is the people working there and the way they treat their guests. The moment we drove up and met the valet, Gavin, we felt like a wet blanket had been thrown on us. He was rude beyond belief. He just stood there and watched while we unloaded the car and looked around for a luggage cart. He didn't help us at all. He made snide comments about the people in front of us, because they were not using the valet service. He had such a pompous attitude. A bit later, my husband went looking for ice. The ice machines on the second and third floors weren't working and didn't have out-of-order signs, so he went to the front desk to let them know and to get ice. Gavin was standing nearby, and said to my husband, why don't you just call room service? Haven't you stayed in a hotel before? Unbelievable! We stayed for 2 nights and every time we ran into Gavin, he glared or said something rude. When we left, while we were waiting for the other valet to bring our car around, Gavin started making comments about my husband’s shoes. When my husband told him to get away from him, this guy wouldn't leave us alone. Even as we were driving out of the driveway, he stood right in front of our car.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever

reviews.text: The front desk staff was friendly, but not very knowledgeable about their city. They did not have any brochures out, so when I asked for a map and some brochures of things to do, they had to look under the front desk. I got the map, but they asked what kind of things I wanted to do, so they could figure out what brochures to give me. As this was my first trip to Portland, I wasn't sure of all the things that the city had to offer, and being able to look at all the brochures and pick and choose for myself would have been most helpful.
reviews.title: A good visit.

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Portland Downtown Waterfront Hotel

Everything is within walking distance and you will enjoy the convenience of boutique shopping, gourmet restaurants, and fabulous art galleries being nearby. Steps from our Portland, ME hotel's front door you will find the Portland Trails jogging path, fishing and sailing tours, as well as great family attractions. We're also conveniently located near area attractions such as Hadlock Field, home of the Red Sox affiliate Portland Seadogs, Portland Museum of Art, Merrill Auditorium and Cumberland County Civic Center.
